required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Holmium Laser Enucleation Prostatectomy and Open Transvesical Prostatectomy in Large Prostate
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Holmium Laser Enucleation Prostatectomy and Open Transvesical Prostatectomy in Large Prostate More Than 80 Grams in Egyptian Men

brief_summary.textblock: comparison of holmium laser enucleation prostatectomy and open prostatectomy regarding safety and efficacy in men with prostate larger than 80 grams

primary_outcome.measure: efficacy by measuring maximum urinary flow rate in millilitre per second
primary_outcome.description: change of maximum urinary flow rate in mililiter per second pre and post opeartive

primary_outcome.measure: efficacy in american urological association symptom score
primary_outcome.description: change of american urological association symptom score pre and post operative by scale from 1 to 35

primary_outcome.measure: efficacy of evacuation by measuring post-voiding residual urine volume in millilitre
primary_outcome.description: change of post-voiding residual urine volume in millilitre

secondary_outcome.measure: safety by doing blood picture to asses hemoglobin drop
secondary_outcome.description: rate of hemoglobin drop post-operatively by gram per decilitre

intervention.description: laser enucleation of the gland versus open enucleation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Urological Association Symptom Score of eight or higher,
- Maximum urinary flow rate of 10ml/s or less,
- Post void residual urine volume of 50 ml or more,
- And a total prostate volume of 80 ml or more in transrectal ultrasound (TRUS).
Exclusion Criteria:
- A previous prostate or urethral surgery
- And non-BPH related voiding disorders
- Prostate cancer patients

responsible_party.investigator_title: mohamed nabil alnoomani, assistant lecturer of urology
